name: Starhotels Michelangelo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed 5 nights at the michealangelo hotel in rome and recommend this hotel to anyone, our room was lovely sheets changed every day, which you do not get in a 5 star hotel!!!! we had a room with a balcony overlooking the dome of st peters, very nice a night with a bottle of wine. Breakfast plenty of choice and served from 7 till 10.30. - we are going again next year and will certainly book again at this wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from August 7th-11TH. We were a group of eight people, including my aunt who is disabled. On arriving at the hotel the reception staff were rude and looked like they couldnt be bothered to talk to us. The rooms had dirty walls and the smell of drains occcured every time we flushed the toilet or took a shower.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was ok, however no variety to it, Cereals, scrambled eggs ( Very Greasy) and bacon, also had crossaints, jam etc.
reviews.title: awful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent, close to st peters square and Vatican. I advised strongly that if you do stay at this hotel you avoid the nearby restaurants.... A total rip off and food was something i wouldn't even feed my dog.
reviews.title: Most Convenient
Great location near the Vatican
reviews.text: Altough the food and hotel were apalling i would return to Rome as it is Amazing BUT would not stay a this hotel. Even received very disgraceful looks from the Hotel staff as we wished them a goodbye.

reviews.title: Terrible service - great location
reviews.text: Great location (next to the Vatican) and nice rooms. Service, however, was the poorest I'd ever experienced. The staff was rude and unresponsive. The staff wouldn't call a call, yelled and scolded at us when we asked to iron something, had poor security, and were downright mean. Their restaurant suggestions were high priced with fair food. Other guests had purses stolen during breakfast and the staff was unresponsive. They are expensive due to the location. I expected basic customer service, yet they treated guests as if they were "doing them a favor." If Starhotel executives read this, I urge you to change management there and implement a customer service program, such as that offered by the Ritz Carlton. They could even learns something from Super8 Motels! Only go there for the location. Bring your own security alarm for the room as they share the keys. Don't ask any questions!

reviews.title: Terrible Service
reviews.text: Katie, a very dissatisfied world traveler.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Starhotels Michelangelo from July 13-16. The only things going for this hotel are the location and the clean room. If you need anything else from the hotel, you're out of luck! The service from the reception desk was awful. Each time we asked the desk for something, the answer was, "No!". My family and I couldn't believe how rude the staff was at this hotel. They were completely unaccommodating. We stayed at other hotels in other cities throughout Italy, and we found this hotel to be the worst in customer relations. First of all, the hotel gives you a key on a key chain the weight of a small dumbbell and they encourage you to leave it with them at the desk when you leave. We asked them to supply a second key and they said, "No!". So each time we left the hotel, we left the key at the desk. FYI - there was no safe on the hotel rooms. Then when we returned to the hotel, we would ask for our room key from an entirely different set of staff and they would give it to us without asking to see any identification. I felt uneasy leaving the key and without having them check to see if we were really staying in the hotel. Anyone could ask for a key from the desk and get one. We asked to have an iron sent to our room and was rudely told, "No!". The hotel reception desk told us that it's against the law in Italy to have an iron in your room. We were unaware of this "law" because we had an iron sent to our rooms in other hotels we stayed at throughout Italy and was never told "no" or that is was against the law. Since we couldn't borrow an iron, we asked if there was an ironing service and we were told, "It's too late!" So the next day we asked for ironing service earlier in the day and was given a hard time by the reception desk once again. They looked at us like we were asking for something unheard of. We proceeded to wait as the reception desk called for the maid. After, they said we would have to wait one hour and that the cost is 12 Euros per piece! We said no thanks. We decided to wear wrinkled clothes. The "American breakfast buffet" was disgusting! The eggs were made of powder and looked fake as they were bright yellow in color. How hard is it to mess up powdered eggs? They were runny and made me feel nauseous when I ate them for the first time. The breads they served were a strange tasting croissants and a loaf of breads. The meat they served was greasy and undercooked. My husband, who has a bad stomach was sick after eating breakfast the first morning. After that, he ate bread with butter the next two days. I was hoping the coffee would be good, but I was disappointed again! The coffee was awful too! I opted to eat the cold cereal and drank the juice instead. The service at breakfast was lacking as well. There was a number of staff walking around the dining room, however not one of the staff members on the three mornings we were there, asked if everything was okay. The hotel was booked of people on a Globus tour. You will see the Globus tour people at breakfast if you go early enough. It seems that the Starhotels Michelangelo is more concerned with packing out there hotel with people rather than taking care of them. Do not ask the reception desk for recommendations for restaurants, they will guide you to expensive restaurants that have mediocre food. You are better off reading other people's trip reports. The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to focus your Rome trip on the Vatican. The room was clean and comfortable. Starhotels Michelangelo desperately needs to work on their service. I know we were in another country but I didn't think we were on a different planet. Starhotels Michelangelo had the worst service out of all the hotels we stayed in Italy!
reviews.title: Great place near the Vatican
Michelangelo Hotel Rome Italy: watch your belongings: thieves in dining room
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel on our first day it Italy. We arrived to the hotel very early, well before check-in, and they kindly put our bags in a locked closet for us to retrieve later. We then set out to explore the Vatican which is only a 5 to 6 minute walk. The room was perfect and the breakfast provided was quite a spread. We were told not to expect much for breakfast from Italian hotels but this one delivered and then some.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel in Rome Italy July 5th and 6th, 2007. Unfortunately we were robbed while having breakfast in the dining room of the hotel. When I reported this to the staff in the dining room, they did not seem to care at all. I then reported t his to the hotel management and with much reluctance they tried to assist me and admitted that there were thieves (high class, well dressed) posing as tourists who occassionally come to eat in their dining room - even though they were not staying in the hotel. Needless to say, being robbed of all your money, credit cards, personal documents etc, on your first day in Italy is enough to ruin your holiday .
reviews.title: Way better than we expected

likes.liked: — Proximity to St. Peter's and great restaurants.
likes.disliked: — The staff could have been friendlier. Then again, they were Roman!

reviews.text: Meals were good, staff helpful, accommodation more than adequate and the hotel is close to the Vatican and provides a good base for access to other attractions. We wnt with a Globus tour group.
reviews.title: Liked the hotel

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is fantastic. It was a 5 min walk to the Vatican and only a 10 min drive to the Colosseum. Free breakfast every morning that was not bad. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a balcony facing the front of the hotel. We could see Saint Peters Church from our balcony. The rooms were clean and not a bad size. The room key was not a card but an actual key that was bulky to carry around. the best thing to do is leave it at the front desk when you go out and pick it back up when you come back. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Starhotels Michelangelo for a week during our 30th wedding anniversary. We selected this hotel through a vacation package offered by Travelocity. The hotel is quite convenient for access to The Vatican (where we spent a lot of time), and other locations as well, especially if you're willing to walk or take public transportation (which we did).
reviews.title: Convenient Location, But Not A 4-Star Hotel
Lovely room, great location
reviews.text: We were initially taken aback when we first arrived at the hotel's location. This was primarily due to aesthetic reasons; we failed to realize beforehand that Rome in general, despite its picturesque settings, is thousands of years old and looks like it. Cars are jammed packed together, trash dumpsters line the street right outside the hotel, and litter is quite prevalent. On top of that the hotel staff was NOT overly friendly and they did not come across as being dedicated to making sure our stay at their hotel was a top priority. The first room we were assigned reinforced our opinion that we (I) had selected the wrong hotel, especially for the pre-paid money we had put up. The carpet was worn, both seats of the chairs in the room were heavily stained and one had its fabric torn, and the walls were heavily marked with luggageg scrape marks. After complaining to the manager, he had a bellhop show us another room that was better (hardwood floors instead of carpet), but was still not up to what I would expect for a 4-star hotel. On the positive side, the bathrooms were great! I really appreciated the US electrical plug.

Breakfast was included in the room rate, and its buffet was wide ranging, very good, and quite plentiful. We ate their every morning. We never ate lunch in the hotel, but we did eat dinner there once, and would never do it again. We paid the equivalent of $190+ dollars for dinner for 2, with a half carafe of wine. The food, its quality, and the service may have been worth half that much, and that is being generous. We ate dinner at a very nice restaurant across the river for about the same amount, and it was well worth the expense and the experience. By the way, we walked to and from the restaurant during numerous nightime escapades, and felt completely safe each time.
reviews.title: Not soo sure about the Michelangelo
Nice room but management has bad attitude
reviews.text: This 4-star hotel is located on the edge of the Vatican City, a good base to explore the stunning Eternal City. Re the location, if you wish to head east towards the city centre proper, the quickest route is via a tunnel, but beware that this is an unpleasant walk (noisy, dark, atmosphere a bit menacing). You are probably best to take a longer route and go via the Vatican and take a metro or just get a taxi. Our room was nice and had been recently refurbished. However, the air con wasn't working and when we asked the manager to fix it, the attitude we received was just unbelievable. Apparently the management centrally controls when the air con operates, even though there are individual controls in the rooms. Our room was genuinely very stuffy, but the response was pretty much, "tough, open the windows if you're hot"! Now this would be OK if the hotel was a budget 2-star, but Michelangelo is a 4-star hotel and I felt this was downright rude and unacceptable. Breakfast was OK - the American-style buffet was a bit greasy and there was definitely an over-abundance of staff who seemed to be walking around doing very little. Overall, this place is OK if you get a decent rate. Otherwise, I would avoid.

reviews.title: Location, location, location!
reviews.text: We stayed at his hotel in May 2007, and found it entirely satisfactory. Its major asset from our viewpoint was its location- only a block or so from St. Peters Basilica. The Vatican museums and St Peters are incredibly crowded even in May, and it was great to be able to walk "next door" and access these tourist meccas early in the morning as they're opening. This meant that our wait in line was either negligible or non-existant.. The accomodations were clean and comfortable but not exactly plush. The front desk people were helpful and friendly in a measured and careful sort of way. The restaurant served entirely satisfactory but not extravagant food. We thought it was pretty expensive for the quality of food served. The morning breakfasts which were included in our package, on the other hand, were the best we saw in Italy in our opinion.

reviews.title: Loved the Michelangelo
reviews.text: We definitely will stay here gain on our next trip to Rome, and we recommend it to everyone.

reviews.title: Hotel good - location great for st peters but not in centre
reviews.text: Hotel was great. Location was perfect for Vatican (4 blocks). Staff was very accomodating and room was very nice. Would definitely stay there if Vatican was tops on my list. Pretty easy walk to Piazza Navona.

reviews.title: Not quite what i had in mind
reviews.text: Hotel was good - room great but was at front of hotel so bit noisy. Just a couple of minutes from St Peters but you had to take a bus or walk 10 mins to the metro to get to any of the other sites e.g. spanish steps, trevi

description: Welcome to Starhotels Michelangelo, 4 star hotel in central Rome. Of all Rome hotels, we're so close to the Vatican that select rooms enjoy close-up dramatic views of St Peter's Dome. The Sistine Chapel is just steps away and we're walking distance to many historic wonders such as Colosseum and Castel Saint Angelo.Our beautiful hotel in central Rome is a triumph of traditional design and Baroque style, with 179 rooms and suites. The Dome restaurant serves superb international and Roman cuisine.Come and stay in an incredible location and enjoy the very best of the eternal city.
